medicines.usage: For relief of mild to moderate pain and fever
medicines.dosageAdult: 1-2 tablets (500-1000mg) every 4-6 hours as needed, maximum 4000mg/day
medicines.dosageChild: 10-15mg/kg every 4-6 hours, consult doctor for children under 2
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, but monitor liver function
medicines.sideEffects: Rare when used as directed. May cause liver damage if taken in excess.
medicines.warnings: Do not take with other paracetamol-containing products. Avoid alcohol. Not recommended with liver disease.

symptomMappings.notes: Effective for mild to moderate headaches

medicines.usage: For pain, inflammation, and fever reduction
medicines.dosageAdult: 200-400mg every 4-6 hours as needed, maximum 1200mg/day
medicines.dosageChild: 5-10mg/kg every 6-8 hours for children over 6 months
medicines.dosageElderly: Lower dose recommended, monitor kidney function
medicines.sideEffects: Stomach upset, nausea, dizziness. May increase risk of bleeding.
medicines.warnings: Take with food. Not recommended for people with stomach ulcers, kidney disease, or on blood thinners.

symptomMappings.notes: Excellent for tension headaches and migraines

medicines.dosageAdult: 4 tablets at 0h, 4 tablets at 8h, 4 tablets at 24h, 4 tablets at 48h, 4 tablets at 60h
medicines.dosageChild: Dosage based on body weight, consult doctor
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, monitor for side effects
medicines.sideEffects: Headache, dizziness, loss of appetite, weakness
medicines.warnings: Take with food. Not for severe malaria. Complete full course.

medicines.dosageAdult: 4 tablets at 0h, 4 tablets at 8h, 4 tablets at 24h, 4 tablets at 48h, 4 tablets at 60h
medicines.dosageChild: Dosage based on body weight, consult doctor
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, monitor for side effects
medicines.sideEffects: Headache, dizziness, loss of appetite, weakness
medicines.warnings: Take with food. Not for severe malaria. Complete full course.

medicines.dosageAdult: 4 tablets at 0h, 4 tablets at 8h, 4 tablets at 24h, 4 tablets at 48h, 4 tablets at 60h
medicines.dosageChild: Dosage based on body weight, consult doctor
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, monitor for side effects
medicines.sideEffects: Headache, dizziness, loss of appetite, weakness
medicines.warnings: Take with food. Not for severe malaria. Complete full course.

medicines.dosageAdult: 2.4mg/kg IV/IM at 0h, 12h, 24h, then once daily
medicines.dosageChild: 2.4mg/kg IV/IM at 0h, 12h, 24h, then once daily
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, monitor for side effects
medicines.warnings: For severe malaria only. Administered by healthcare professionals.

medicines.usage: Nutritional supplement during pregnancy and breastfeeding
medicines.dosageAdult: 1 tablet daily with food
medicines.dosageChild: Not for children
medicines.dosageElderly: Not for elderly unless prescribed
medicines.sideEffects: Rare. May cause constipation or dark stools
medicines.warnings: Do not exceed recommended dose. Not a substitute for balanced diet.

medicines.usage: For prevention and treatment of iron deficiency anemia
medicines.dosageAdult: 1 tablet (200mg) 1-3 times daily
medicines.dosageChild: Dosage based on age and weight, consult doctor
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, monitor for constipation
medicines.warnings: Take with food to reduce stomach upset. Keep out of reach of children.

symptomMappings.notes: Effective for fatigue caused by iron deficiency

medicines.usage: For prevention of neural tube defects in pregnancy and folate deficiency
medicines.dosageAdult: 1 tablet (400-800mcg) daily
medicines.dosageChild: Dosage based on age, consult doctor
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult
medicines.sideEffects: Rare. May cause mild stomach upset
medicines.warnings: Do not exceed recommended dose. Important during pregnancy.

symptomMappings.notes: May help with fatigue caused by folate deficiency

medicines.usage: For prevention and treatment of vitamin C deficiency
medicines.dosageAdult: 1 tablet (500mg) 1-2 times daily
medicines.dosageChild: Half tablet (250mg) daily for children over 4
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult
medicines.sideEffects: Rare. High doses may cause diarrhea
medicines.warnings: Do not exceed recommended dose. Not a substitute for balanced diet.

symptomMappings.notes: May help with fatigue caused by vitamin C deficiency

medicines.usage: For prevention and treatment of vitamin D deficiency
medicines.dosageAdult: 1 tablet (1000-2000 IU) daily
medicines.dosageChild: Dosage based on age, consult doctor
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, may need higher dose
medicines.sideEffects: Rare. High doses may cause hypercalcemia
medicines.warnings: Do not exceed recommended dose. Not a substitute for sun exposure.

symptomMappings.notes: May help with fatigue caused by vitamin D deficiency
May help with muscle pain caused by vitamin D deficiency

medicines.usage: For prevention and treatment of calcium deficiency
medicines.dosageAdult: 1 tablet (500mg) 1-2 times daily with meals
medicines.dosageChild: Dosage based on age, consult doctor
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, may need higher dose
medicines.warnings: Do not exceed recommended dose. Take with meals for better absorption.

symptomMappings.notes: May help with muscle pain caused by calcium deficiency

medicines.usage: For prevention and treatment of zinc deficiency
medicines.dosageAdult: 1 tablet (50mg) daily with food
medicines.dosageChild: Dosage based on age, consult doctor
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult
medicines.warnings: Do not exceed recommended dose. Take with food to reduce stomach upset.

symptomMappings.notes: May help with skin problems caused by zinc deficiency

medicines.dosageAdult: 250-500mg every 8 hours
medicines.dosageChild: 20-50mg/kg/day divided into 2-3 doses
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, monitor kidney function
medicines.warnings: Complete full course. Not for viral infections. May cause allergic reactions.

symptomMappings.notes: Effective for fever caused by bacterial infections

medicines.dosageAdult: 500mg on day 1, then 250mg on days 2-5
medicines.dosageChild: 10mg/kg on day 1, then 5mg/kg on days 2-5
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult
medicines.warnings: Complete full course. Not for viral infections. May cause allergic reactions.

symptomMappings.notes: Effective for cough caused by bacterial infections
Effective for fever caused by bacterial infections

medicines.dosageAdult: 250-750mg every 12 hours
medicines.dosageChild: Not recommended for children under 18
medicines.dosageElderly: Lower dose recommended, monitor kidney function
medicines.warnings: Complete full course. Not for viral infections. May cause tendon damage.

symptomMappings.notes: Effective for abdominal pain caused by bacterial infections

medicines.dosageAdult: 100mg every 12 hours
medicines.dosageChild: Not recommended for children under 8
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult
medicines.warnings: Complete full course. Not for viral infections. May cause photosensitivity.

medicines.usage: For treatment of bacterial and protozoal infections
medicines.dosageAdult: 500mg every 8 hours
medicines.dosageChild: 15mg/kg/day divided into 3 doses
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult
medicines.warnings: Complete full course. Avoid alcohol during treatment and for 3 days after.

symptomMappings.notes: Effective for abdominal pain caused by protozoal infections

medicines.usage: For treatment of serious bacterial infections
medicines.dosageAdult: 150-450mg every 6 hours
medicines.dosageChild: 8-25mg/kg/day divided into 3-4 doses
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult
medicines.warnings: Complete full course. Not for viral infections. May cause C. difficile infection.

symptomMappings.notes: Effective for serious bacterial skin infections

medicines.usage: For relief of allergy symptoms, cold symptoms, and as sleep aid
medicines.dosageAdult: 25-50mg every 4-6 hours as needed
medicines.dosageChild: Not recommended for children under 6
medicines.dosageElderly: Lower dose recommended
medicines.sideEffects: Drowsiness, dry mouth, dizziness, blurred vision
medicines.warnings: May cause drowsiness. Avoid alcohol. Not recommended with glaucoma.

symptomMappings.notes: Can help with mild skin rashes

medicines.usage: For relief of nasal congestion due to colds, allergies, or sinusitis
medicines.dosageAdult: 60mg every 4-6 hours as needed
medicines.dosageChild: Not recommended for children under 12
medicines.dosageElderly: Lower dose recommended
medicines.sideEffects: Nervousness, dizziness, sleeplessness, increased heart rate
medicines.warnings: May cause sleeplessness. Not recommended with heart conditions, high blood pressure, or thyroid problems.

medicines.usage: For fast relief of heartburn, sour stomach, and acid indigestion
medicines.dosageAdult: 2-4 tablets as needed, maximum 15 tablets in 24 hours
medicines.dosageChild: Consult doctor for children under 12
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, but monitor calcium intake
medicines.warnings: Do not take more than 2 weeks without consulting a doctor. Not recommended with kidney disease.

symptomMappings.notes: May help with nausea related to indigestion

medicines.usage: For relief of heartburn, acid indigestion, and sour stomach
medicines.dosageAdult: 10-20ml after meals and at bedtime
medicines.dosageChild: 5-10ml after meals and at bedtime
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult
medicines.warnings: Do not take more than recommended dose. Not recommended with kidney disease.

symptomMappings.notes: May help with nausea related to indigestion

medicines.description: Proton pump inhibitor for acid reflux
medicines.usage: For treatment of frequent heartburn and acid reflux
medicines.dosageAdult: 20mg once daily before a meal
medicines.dosageChild: Not recommended for children under 18
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult
medicines.warnings: Do not take for more than 14 days without consulting a doctor. Not for immediate relief.

symptomMappings.notes: May help with nausea related to acid reflux
Effective for stomach pain caused by acid reflux

medicines.usage: For control and relief of acute diarrhea
medicines.dosageAdult: 2 capsules initially, then 1 capsule after each loose stool
medicines.dosageChild: Not recommended for children under 12
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, monitor for constipation
medicines.warnings: Do not use for more than 2 days without consulting a doctor. Not for bacterial infections.

medicines.usage: For prevention and treatment of dehydration due to diarrhea
medicines.dosageAdult: 1 sachet dissolved in 1 liter of water, drink as needed
medicines.dosageChild: 1 sachet dissolved in 1 liter of water, drink as needed
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult
medicines.warnings: Use clean water. Do not add sugar. Discard unused solution after 24 hours.

medicines.usage: For relief of abdominal cramps and spasms
medicines.dosageAdult: 1-2 tablets 3 times daily
medicines.dosageChild: Not recommended for children under 6
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult
medicines.warnings: May cause drowsiness. Not recommended with glaucoma.

medicines.usage: For treatment of bacterial and protozoal infections
medicines.dosageAdult: 500mg every 8 hours
medicines.dosageChild: 15mg/kg/day divided into 3 doses
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult
medicines.warnings: Complete full course. Avoid alcohol during treatment and for 3 days after.

symptomMappings.notes: Effective for abdominal pain caused by protozoal infections

medicines.dosageAdult: 1 tablet (800mg/160mg) every 12 hours
medicines.dosageChild: Dosage based on weight, consult doctor
medicines.dosageElderly: Lower dose recommended, monitor kidney function
medicines.warnings: Complete full course. Not for viral infections. May cause allergic reactions.

symptomMappings.notes: Effective for abdominal pain caused by bacterial infections

medicines.usage: For treatment of parasitic worm infections
medicines.dosageAdult: 400mg as a single dose
medicines.dosageChild: 400mg as a single dose for children over 2
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult
medicines.warnings: May be taken with or without food. Not recommended during pregnancy.

symptomMappings.notes: Effective for abdominal pain caused by parasitic infections

medicines.usage: For treatment of parasitic worm infections
medicines.dosageAdult: 100mg twice daily for 3 days
medicines.dosageChild: 100mg twice daily for 3 days for children over 2
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult
medicines.warnings: May be taken with or without food. Not recommended during pregnancy.

symptomMappings.notes: Effective for abdominal pain caused by parasitic infections

medicines.dosageAdult: 150-200mcg/kg as a single dose
medicines.dosageChild: 150-200mcg/kg as a single dose for children over 5
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult
medicines.warnings: Take on an empty stomach with water. Not recommended during pregnancy.

symptomMappings.notes: Effective for skin rashes caused by parasitic infections

medicines.usage: For treatment of schistosomiasis and other parasitic infections
medicines.dosageAdult: 20mg/kg as a single dose
medicines.dosageChild: 20mg/kg as a single dose for children over 4
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult
medicines.warnings: Take with food. Not recommended during pregnancy.

symptomMappings.notes: Effective for abdominal pain caused by schistosomiasis

medicines.usage: For treatment of malaria and autoimmune diseases
medicines.dosageAdult: 400mg weekly for malaria prevention
medicines.dosageChild: 6.5mg/kg weekly for malaria prevention
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, monitor for eye problems
medicines.warnings: Take with food. May cause eye problems with long-term use.

symptomMappings.notes: May help with joint pain in autoimmune diseases

medicines.dosageAdult: 600mg every 8 hours for 7 days
medicines.dosageChild: 10mg/kg every 8 hours for 7 days
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, monitor for hearing problems
medicines.warnings: Take with food. May cause hearing problems. Not for mild malaria.

medicines.dosageAdult: 200mg daily
medicines.dosageChild: 3mg/kg daily
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult
medicines.warnings: Take with food. Start before entering malaria area and continue for 4 weeks after leaving.

medicines.usage: For treatment of bacterial infections and malaria prevention
medicines.dosageAdult: 100mg daily for malaria prevention
medicines.dosageChild: Not recommended for children under 8
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult
medicines.warnings: Take with food. May cause photosensitivity. Not for children under 8.

medicines.usage: For prevention and treatment of malaria
medicines.dosageAdult: 250mg weekly for prevention
medicines.dosageChild: Not recommended for children under 3 months
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, monitor for psychiatric effects
medicines.sideEffects: Nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, dizziness, psychiatric effects
medicines.warnings: Take with food. May cause psychiatric effects. Not for people with psychiatric history.

medicines.usage: For prevention and treatment of malaria
medicines.dosageAdult: 1 tablet daily for prevention
medicines.dosageChild: Dosage based on weight, consult doctor
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult
medicines.warnings: Take with food. Start before entering malaria area and continue for 7 days after leaving.

symptomMappings.notes: Effective for malaria prevention and treatment

medicines.dosageAdult: 600mg initially, then 300mg after 6 hours, then 300mg daily for 2 days
medicines.dosageChild: 10mg/kg initially, then 5mg/kg after 6 hours, then 5mg/kg daily for 2 days
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, monitor for eye problems
medicines.warnings: Take with food. May cause eye problems with long-term use. Not effective in many areas due to resistance.

medicines.dosageAdult: 600mg daily for 3 days
medicines.dosageChild: 10mg/kg daily for 3 days
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, monitor for liver problems
medicines.warnings: Take with food. May cause liver problems. Not for long-term use.

medicines.dosageAdult: 1.2g as a single dose
medicines.dosageChild: 20mg/kg as a single dose
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, monitor for heart problems
medicines.warnings: Take with food. May cause heart problems. Not for people with heart conditions.

medicines.dosageAdult: 120mg daily for 3 days
medicines.dosageChild: 3mg/kg daily for 3 days
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult
medicines.warnings: Take with food. Not for severe malaria.

medicines.dosageChild: 4mg/kg artesunate and 10mg/kg amodiaquine daily for 3 days
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, monitor for liver problems
medicines.warnings: Take with food. May cause liver problems. Not for severe malaria.

medicines.dosageAdult: 4mg/kg initially, then 2mg/kg after 8 hours, then 2mg/kg daily for 4 days
medicines.dosageChild: 4mg/kg initially, then 2mg/kg after 8 hours, then 2mg/kg daily for 4 days

medicines.warnings: Take with food. Not for severe malaria.

medicines.dosageAdult: 500mg daily for 3 days
medicines.dosageChild: 10mg/kg daily for 3 days
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult
medicines.warnings: Take with food. Not for severe malaria.

medicines.dosageChild: 20mg/kg piperaquine and 3mg/kg dihydroartemisinin as a single dose
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, monitor for heart problems
medicines.warnings: Take with food. May cause heart problems. Not for people with heart conditions.

medicines.dosageAdult: 250mg mefloquine and 4mg/kg artesunate daily for 3 days
medicines.dosageChild: Not recommended for children under 3 months
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, monitor for psychiatric effects

medicines.warnings: Take with food. May cause psychiatric effects. Not for people with psychiatric history.

medicines.dosageAdult: 15mg daily for 14 days
medicines.dosageChild: 0.5mg/kg daily for 14 days
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, monitor for blood problems
medicines.warnings: Take with food. May cause blood problems. Not for people with G6PD deficiency.

medicines.dosageAdult: 200mg weekly for prevention
medicines.dosageChild: Not recommended for children under 16
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, monitor for psychiatric effects
medicines.warnings: Take with food. May cause psychiatric effects. Not for people with psychiatric history or G6PD deficiency.

medicines.dosageAdult: 500mg every 6 hours for 3 doses
medicines.dosageChild: 8mg/kg every 6 hours for 3 doses
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, monitor for heart problems
medicines.warnings: Take with food. May cause heart problems. Not for people with heart conditions.

medicines.warnings: Take with food. May cause eye problems with long-term use.

symptomMappings.notes: May help with joint pain in autoimmune diseases

medicines.usage: For prevention and treatment of malaria
medicines.dosageAdult: 250mg weekly for prevention
medicines.dosageChild: Not recommended for children under 3 months
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, monitor for psychiatric effects
medicines.sideEffects: Nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, dizziness, psychiatric effects
medicines.warnings: Take with food. May cause psychiatric effects. Not for people with psychiatric history.

medicines.dosageAdult: 648mg every 8 hours for 3 days
medicines.dosageChild: 10mg/kg every 8 hours for 3 days
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, monitor for hearing problems
medicines.sideEffects: Nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, tinnitus, hearing loss
medicines.warnings: Take with food. May cause hearing problems. Not for mild malaria.

medicines.dosageAdult: 200mg weekly for prevention
medicines.dosageChild: Not recommended for children under 16
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, monitor for psychiatric effects
medicines.warnings: Take with food. May cause psychiatric effects. Not for people with psychiatric history or G6PD deficiency.

medicines.dosageAdult: 300mg as a single dose
medicines.dosageChild: Not recommended for children under 16
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, monitor for psychiatric effects
medicines.warnings: Take with food. May cause psychiatric effects. Not for people with psychiatric history or G6PD deficiency.

medicines.dosageAdult: 4 tablets at 0h, 4 tablets at 8h, 4 tablets at 24h, 4 tablets at 48h, 4 tablets at 60h
medicines.dosageChild: Dosage based on body weight, consult doctor
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, monitor for side effects
medicines.sideEffects: Headache, dizziness, loss of appetite, weakness
medicines.warnings: Take with food. Not for severe malaria. Complete full course.

medicines.dosageAdult: 4 tablets at 0h, 4 tablets at 8h, 4 tablets at 24h, 4 tablets at 48h, 4 tablets at 60h
medicines.dosageChild: Dosage based on body weight, consult doctor
medicines.dosageElderly: Same as adult, monitor for side effects
medicines.sideEffects: Headache, dizziness, loss of appetite, weakness
medicines.warnings: Take with food. Not for severe malaria. Complete full course.
